creditline: The Christina N. and Swan J. Turnblad Memorial Fund, 1966
provenance: (P. & D. Colnaghi and Co., Ltd., London, England and New York, New York); sold to MIA, 1966.
text: Growing up on a farm on the island of Jersey, in the English Channel, Edmund Blampied developed a deep love of animals, especially horses. This simple, forthright rendering of a lone workhorse in a windswept Normandy pasture reveals his sympathy for these powerful, majestic animals he knew so well.
title: A Normandy Horse
